instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?


Any suggestions pls?

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message:
1. I have Green light on charger.
2. I have 3.42v on <SIGNAL>SMC_B_ACOK</SIGNAL>
3. I have 3.42v on PIN 5 ADAPTER SENSE (<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>)
4. I have <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> shows 4.0v
5. I have 12.6v on FUSE 7040 which goes to system.

Still NO FAN SPIN and no start, 

Is there anything I'm missing from here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message:
Do you have original 85W charger?
Does it charge battery, or starts when battery and charger are both connected?
Touch <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground and see reaction on <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.
Post values for <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> signals.
Any fault history?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message: History? Random powering off will suck. Could be corrosion under something or some corroded pad or resistor somewhere. History is going to be the most important thing here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message: If it was booting then shutting off, the GPU is likely dead and this is gonna be a waste of time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message: ^ This. I thought the OP meant quarter fan spin

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message: Likely GPU is dead and you are not using a 85W charger. Let the battery charge up so you have a few lights on the battery indicator, it should then be able to power from battery even with 60W charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message:
Thanks everyone for your feedback.

I followed Duke advice.

I recharged the battery full with 60W charger. (Im buying 80W tmr).. The computer boot now, apple logo comes on, and the load bar. But that remains only for 3 seconds then computer shuts off again.

Any suggestions on that?.. Could it be GPU, and if so, how can I check that. Is it possible to reflow the GPU a bit? Ultrasonic will that help? or is it bye bye with this motherboard and only use the spareparts for future work?

HISTORY: The computer is NOT water damaged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message: Sounds like a dead GPU. If its not liquid damaged, UC'ing it won't do a thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="TCRScircuit, post: 37856"]Sounds like a dead GPU. If its not liquid damaged, UC'ing it won't do a thing.[/QUOTE]
Thanks buddy.. really appreciate your feedback.. I shall wait for Duke feedback as well and see what he says.. once again, thank you for helping out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message: The computer is hanging on boot and shutting down because it is the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>’s way of saying I’m fucked lol. This model is notorious for that exact symptom being caused by a dead GPU. You can replace it, but good luck finding a real GPU

threads.message:

This model is notorious for that exact symptom being caused by a dead GPU. You can replace it, but good luck finding a real GPU[/QUOTE]
Thanks JohnB8812 for your feedback. I have similar motherboards with functioning GPU. Do you recommend I should take it from the board with functioning GPU and place it onto this damaged one?

Real GPU? can u recommend any websites? Aliexpress perhaps?

What about REFLOW?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message:
Tried booting from a known good OSX through USB? If that has the same result it will be a dead GPU.

REAL new GPUs are unobtanium pretty much and reflow is bullshit and only temporary.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard starting and then suddenly shuts off?
threads.message:
No Title

I tried boot from good USB osx.. And i got this.. I guess the GPU is gone for ever?

The motherboard gets warm really fast and starts smelling burned close up..
